metadata.name: PowerElecLLM Combined Benchmark - Test Set
metadata.description: 100 problems (held out) combining expert-verified and synthetic design problems

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter: 24V to 48V, 4A for hybrid vehicle auxiliary. Constraint: Bidirectional operation for regeneration

problems.prompt: Design an inverting buck-boost: 5V USB to -5V, 1A for RS-232 interface

problems.problem_text:
A three phase star-connected load is drawing power at a voltage of 0.9 pu and 0.8 power factor 
lagging. The three phase base power and base current are 100 MVA and 437.38 A respectively. The 
line-to-line load voltage in kV is ________.

Question Number : 15 Correct : 1 Wrong : -0.33 For the power semiconductor devices IGBT, MOSFET, Diode and Thyristor, which one of the following statements is TRUE? (A) All the four are majority carrier devices. (B) All the four are minority carrier devices. (C) IGBT and MOSFET are majority carrier devices. whereas Diode and Thyristor are minority carrier devices. (D) MOSFET is majority carrier device. whereas IGBT, Diode, Thyristor are minority carrier devices.

problems.prompt: Superconducting Quantum Interference Device Bias: Ultra-low-noise flux-locked loop electronics for SQUID magnetometer
problems.application: Ultra-low-noise flux-locked loop electronics for SQUID magnetometer

problems.problem_text:
A single-phase SCR based ac regulator is feeding power to a load consisting of 5 Ω resistance and 
16 mH inductance. The input supply is 230 V, 50 Hz ac. The maximum firing angle at which the 
voltage across the device becomes zero all throughout and the rms value of current through SCR, 
under this operating condition, are 
(A)  300  and 46 A 
(B)  300 and 23 A 
(C)  450 and 23 A 
(D)  450 and 32 A

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter: 12V to 170V, 200mA for nixie tube display.

problems.problem_statement: Design an inductor for a 150W, 140kHz boost converter with Vin=14V, Vout=42V, L=6µH using 3F3 ferrite RM-core. Max flux density 0.3T, max current density 500A/cm². Calculate ripple ratio and peak inductor current at full load.
problems.solution_approach: Magnetic design with core saturation constraints

problems.prompt: Design a forward converter for subsea BOP (blowout preventer) control electronics. Input: 400V from subsea power cable, Output: 24V at 15A. Must survive 3000m depth (300 bar pressure), 25-year design life, and operate in oil-filled pressure-compensated enclosure.
problems.application: Subsea Oil & Gas Equipment

problems.prompt: Design an average current-mode boost: 12V to 24V, 3A. 5kHz bandwidth for PFC.
Quantum Cascade Laser Driver for Spectroscopy: Mid-IR spectroscopy system requiring pulsed QCL power for gas sensing
problems.application: Mid-IR spectroscopy system requiring pulsed QCL power for gas sensing

problems.problem_text:
The single phase rectifier consisting of three thyristors T1, T2, T3 and a diode D1 
feed power to a 10 A constant current load. T1 and T3 are fired at α = 60° and T2 is 
fired at α = 240°. The reference for α is the positive zero crossing of Vin. The average 
voltage VO across the load in volts is _____ (Round off to 2 decimal places).

problems.prompt: Design an isolated DC-DC for telecom: 36-72V input to 3.3V/50A with hot-swap.
Ocean Floor Observatory Power System: Deep sea cabled observatory node at 6000m depth requiring 25-year service life
problems.application: Deep sea cabled observatory node at 6000m depth requiring 25-year service life

problems.prompt: Solar Inverter Grid-Tie Stage: Residential solar inverter requiring grid-tied operation with anti-islanding
problems.application: Residential solar inverter requiring grid-tied operation with anti-islanding

problems.prompt: Wind Turbine Pitch Controller Supply: Blade pitch control system requiring operation in nacelle environment
problems.application: Blade pitch control system requiring operation in nacelle environment

problems.prompt: Handheld Game Console Power: Retro handheld gaming device with LCD display
problems.application: Retro handheld gaming device with LCD display

problems.prompt: Lunar Gateway Station Power Distribution: Cislunar space station requiring 50 kW power distribution from solar arrays
problems.application: Cislunar space station requiring 50 kW power distribution from solar arrays

problems.problem_text: Problem 1.1 KSV

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter: 48V telecom to 3.3V, 20A. Interleaved for ripple cancellation.

Design a wireless power receiver flyback converter for implantable neurostimulator charging. Input: 5V-12V from rectified wireless coil, Output: 4.2V at 0.5A for Li-ion charging. Must minimize heat dissipation (<0.5W), volume (<1cm³), and magnetic emissions while achieving safe isolation.
problems.application: Implantable Medical Device Charger

problems.prompt: Design a forward converter for superconducting NMR magnet heater and sensors. Input: 48V external, Output: 24V at 10A. Must operate at 4K liquid helium temperature (electronics at room temp), minimize heat leak into cryostat, and provide ultra-stable current for shimming.
problems.application: Cryogenic NMR Magnet

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter for automotive LIDAR sensor array. Input: 12V from vehicle bus, Output: 3.3V at 8A for VCSEL driver and processing. Must have input voltage range covering cold crank (6V) to load dump (42V) with zero output interruption.
problems.application: LIDAR Sensor Array Power

problems.prompt: Design a flyback converter for remote pipeline cathodic protection system. Input: 12V-48V from solar panel or thermoelectric generator, Output: -1.5V to -3V adjustable at 50A for ground bed. Must operate unattended for 5 years, survive lightning, and handle highly variable load impedance.
problems.application: Pipeline Cathodic Protection

problems.prompt: Design a flyback converter: 12V to 5V isolated, 2A for USB isolator. Constraint: Isolation voltage > 2.5kV RMS

problems.prompt: Stage Lighting DMX Supply: Professional stage lighting fixture requiring DMX control interface
problems.application: Professional stage lighting fixture requiring DMX control interface

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter for supercapacitor-based UPS. Input: 2.7V-5.4V (2-cell supercap bank), Output: 12V at 5A for 30 seconds backup. Must extract maximum energy from supercaps as voltage drops, with controlled discharge to 1.35V/cell.
problems.application: Supercapacitor UPS Module

problems.problem_text:
A three-phase cable is supplying 800 kW and 600 kVAr to an inductive load. It is intended to 
supply an additional resistive load of 100 kW through the same cable without increasing the heat 
dissipation in the cable, by providing a three-phase bank of capacitors connected in star across the 
load. Given the line voltage is 3.3 kV, 50 Hz, the capacitance per phase of the bank, expressed in 
microfarads, is ________.

problems.prompt: Design a quasi-resonant buck: 48V to 12V, 4A. EMI-sensitive application.
Design a boost converter: 3.7V Li-ion to 5V, 2A for USB OTG

problems.problem_statement: A magnetic stimulator circuit has C=180µF, R=85mΩ, L=11µH with diode D. The capacitor is precharged to Vx=950V when switch S is closed. Calculate: (1) Time response of coil current, (2) Peak coil current for Vx=950V, (3) Time t1 when diode D turns on, (4) Energy dissipated in resistor.
problems.solution_approach: Second-order RLC analysis with underdamped response

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter optimized for 10%-100% load efficiency: 24V→5V, 0.5-5A. Achieve >85% efficiency at 10% load and >93% at full load. Consider PFM/PWM mode switching.
Brain-Computer Interface Stimulator Array: High-density cortical stimulation array with 10,000 independent channels
problems.application: High-density cortical stimulation array with 10,000 independent channels

problems.problem_text: Problem 4.3 KSV

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter: 48V to 5V, 8A for PoE powered device. Constraint: Input current ripple < 500mA peak-to-peak
Design a forward converter: 48V to 5V, 8A. Keep transformer size small with f_sw > 200kHz.

problems.prompt: Design a radiation-hardened buck converter for LEO satellite bus power. Input: 28V unregulated solar bus, Output: 5V at 10A. Must balance efficiency (>92%), radiation tolerance (TID 30krad), mass (<150g), and reliability (15-year mission) while operating in -40°C to +85°C.
problems.application: Satellite Bus Power Distribution

problems.problem_text:
A transistor circuit is given below. The Zener diode breakdown voltage is 5.3 V as shown. Take 
base to emitter voltage drop to be 0.6 V. The value of the current gain β is _________.

Warehouse AGV Battery Charger: Automated guided vehicle requiring fast charging with battery management
problems.application: Automated guided vehicle requiring fast charging with battery management

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter: 12V input to 5V output, 2A load current

A single phase, 50 kVA, 1000V/100 V two winding transformer is connected as an autotransformer 
as shown in the figure.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The kVA rating of the autotransformer is _____________.

A single-phase full-bridge diode rectifier feeds a resistive load of 50 Ω from a 200 V, 
50 Hz single phase AC supply. If the diodes are ideal, then the active power, in watts, 
drawn by the load is _____________. (round off to nearest integer).

Problem 0.1 Figure 0.1 shows the circuit diagram of a magnetic stimulator made by an international biomedical electronics company. The pulsed magnetic field generated by the transducer coil (represented by the inductor) can be used in a variety of medical treatments including nerve stimulation. The capacitor is precharged to a Voltage Vx between 0 and 1000 V, and then at t = 0 the switch S is closed to trigger the magnetic pulse. Calculate the following assuming that the switch S and the diode D are ideal: 1. The time response of the coil current after the switch S is closed, as a function of the precharge voltage Vx. (Some types of stimulation require a field with a fast rise time and a slow fall time.) 2. The peak coil current for Vx = 950 V. 3. The time t1 at which diode D turns on. 4. The energy dissipated in the resistor for Vx = 950 V. icoil Ω S C= 180 uF D R= 85 m L = 11 uH + c V -

problems.prompt: Synchrotron Booster Ring Dipole Supply: Particle accelerator requiring ramping dipole magnet power for beam energy increase
constraints: Tracking accuracy ±10 ppm to main ring
problems.application: Particle accelerator requiring ramping dipole magnet power for beam energy increase

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter for polar seismic monitoring station. Input: 6V-12V from radioisotope thermoelectric generator, Output: 28V at 3A for communications. Must operate at -70°C ambient, survive polar bear tampering (3000N force), and run unattended for 10 years.
problems.application: Arctic Seismic Station

problems.prompt: Design a buck converter with fast transient response: 12V→1.8V, 0-20A load step. Must recover to within 3% in <50µs. Calculate output capacitance and control bandwidth.

problems.problem_text: Q.19 The 𝑍-transform of a discrete signal 𝑥[𝑛] is 𝑋(𝑧) = 4𝑧 (𝑧−1 5)(𝑧−2 3)(𝑧−3) with 𝑅𝑂𝐶= 𝑅 . Which one of the following statements is true? (A) Discrete-time Fourier transform of x[n] converges if R is |𝑧| > 3 (B) Discrete-time Fourier transform of x[n] converges if R is 2 3 < |𝑧| < 3 (C) Discrete-time Fourier transform of x[n] converges if R is such that x[n] is a left- sided sequence (D) Discrete-time Fourier transform of x[n] converges if R is such that x[n] is a right- sided sequence Electrical Engineering (EE) Page 16 of 42 Organizing Institute: IIT Kanpur

Which of the following statement(s) is/are true?  
(A) 
If an LTI system is causal, it is stable 
(B) 
A discrete time LTI system is causal if and only if its response to a step input 𝑢[𝑛] 
is 0 for 𝑛< 0 
(C) 
If a discrete time LTI system has an impulse response ℎ[𝑛] of finite duration the 
system is stable 
(D) 
If the impulse response 0 < |ℎ[𝑛]| < 1 for all 𝑛, then the LTI system is stable.

constraints: 1 ms response time for grid support
problems.application: Grid-scale SMES requiring bidirectional power converter for energy storage

problems.application: Voice-controlled smart home hub with always-on microphone array

problems.prompt: Design a half-bridge converter for MRI gradient coil amplifier. Input: 600V DC, Output: ±400V at 300A for gradient coil. Must achieve 2T/m gradient strength, <1μs rise time, and operate continuously during scans without patient acoustic disturbance.
problems.application: Superconducting MRI Gradient

problems.problem_text: Problem 3.1 Shown below is a type of indirect converter known as a SEPIC converter (Single-Ended Primary Inductor Converter). Please calculate its voltage conversion ratio V2/V1. Also, assuming that the capacitors and inductors are all very large (small ripple), please calculate the maximum steady-state voltage on capacitor C1. C1 V1 D C2 R + - V2 - + vC Figure 1 A Single-Ended Primary Inductor Converter (SEPIC Converter).

problems.prompt: Hypersonic Vehicle Actuation Power System: Mach 6+ vehicle requiring power for control surface actuators during atmospheric re-entry
constraints: Actuator response < 10 ms for flight control
problems.application: Mach 6+ vehicle requiring power for control surface actuators during atmospheric re-entry

problems.problem_text: Problem 8.3 Consider the full-bridge resonant converter of KSV Fig. 9.19(a). Assuming the rectified output voltage is constant at a voltage VR, please find an equivalent ac-side resistance for the bridge rectifier Req as a function of VR and the ac current magnitude IA. This can be done with a describing function approach, in which one only considers the fundamental ac component of voltage v’R. Demonstrate that this expression for resistance correctly models power transfer from the dc sources to the rectifier, under the assumption that the inductor current is a pure sinusoid. A steady dc current of 100 A is flowing through a power module (S, D) as shown in Figure (a). The 
V-I characteristics of the IGBT (S) and the diode (D) are shown in Figures (b) and (c), respectively. 
The conduction power loss in the power module (S, D), in watts, is ________.

problems.prompt: Superconducting MRI Gradient Amplifier: High-performance MRI gradient coil driver for 7T research scanner requiring ultra-fast slew rates
constraints: Gradient slew rate > 200 T/m/s for advanced imaging sequences
No acoustic noise coupling to scanner bore
EMI shielding for RF coil compatibility
problems.application: High-performance MRI gradient coil driver for 7T research scanner requiring ultra-fast slew rates

problems.problem_text:
The transistor in the given circuit should always be in active region. Take ܸେ୉ሺୱୟ୲ሻൌ0.2 V,
   ܸ୆୉ൌ0.7 V. The maximum value of ܴ௖ in Ω which can be used, is ______________.

Problem 1.2 Figure 1.1 shows a circuit model for the utility supplying one phase of an ac induction motor. The motor system parameters are Rs = 0.08 Ω, Lls = 1 mH, Lm = 40 mH, Llr = 1 mH, Rr = 0.1 Ω, and Rx = 33 Ω. If the utility voltage is 170·cos(377t), what is the current into the motor? At what power factor is the motor operating? Lls R s L m Llr R r Rx 170cos(377t) i Figure 1.1 A Circuit model for one phase of an induction motor being driven by the utility.

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter: 9V battery pack to 24V, 1.5A for portable amplifier

problems.problem_text:
A single-phase bi-directional voltage source converter (VSC) is shown in the figure below. All 
devices are ideal. It is used to charge a battery at 400 V with power of 5 kW from a source Vs = 220 
V (rms), 50 Hz sinusoidal AC mains at unity p.f. If its AC side interfacing inductor is 5 mH and the 
switches are operated at 20 kHz, then the phase shift (δ) between AC mains voltage (Vs) and 
fundamental AC rms VSC voltage (VC1), in degree, is _________.

problems.prompt: Design a boost converter for high-altitude balloon payload. Input: 5V-8V from flexible solar array, Output: 28V at 2A for payload electronics. Must operate at 35km altitude (-60°C, 1% atmosphere), survive cosmic ray events, and handle 50% solar cell degradation.
problems.application: Stratospheric Balloon Power

problems.prompt: Gaming Console VRM: Next-gen gaming console requiring high-current VRM for APU
problems.application: Next-gen gaming console requiring high-current VRM for APU

problems.prompt: Design a full-bridge converter for 48V to ±15V dual output, 200W total (symmetric loads). Both outputs must track within 1% and share a single transformer.
